subject: Spam and Moderation
msgSnippet: If the only need is to filter out spam, as opposed to actually answering technical questions, I suspect a number of us could function as first line of defense
messageBody:
If the only need is to filter out spam, as opposed to actually answering
technical questions, I suspect a number of us could function as first
line of defense moderators.

Jim

James P. Gunderson, Ph.D. Cognitive Systems Architect
jgunders@... Gamma Two, Inc.
www.gamma-two.com 303.778.7400
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
In the natural environment of a living being, cues, means or pathways
to a goal are usually neither absolutely reliable nor absolutely wrong.
-- Egon Brunswik


didoss@... wrote:
> He is under moderation, so that only appropriate messages should filter through to the list. I believe a suggestion has already been made to him as to how he might resolve the issue on his end.
>
> -------------- Original message --------------
> From: Andrew McDonagh <yahoogroups@...>
> Joe Schmetzer wrote:
>> On Mon, 5 June, 2006 2:17 pm, twall wrote:
>>
>>> On Mon, 5 Jun 2006 at 08:56:14, Bradley, Todd wrote:
>>>
>>>> Didn't JB just announce last week that we have new moderators in place
>>>> for this email list?
>>>>
>>> Unfortunately, tlroche is probably on the not-moderated list, and either
>>> his address is being faked or his PC has been owned.
>>>
>> That *was* correct. I've since put tlroche back under moderation, so we
>> moderators can catch these fantastic offers before the rest of you can
>> even get a look in. 8-)
>>
>> As Anand mentioned, this is a virus that may or may not be actually coming
>> from the sender. tlroche, if you read this, check out
>> http://www.sophos.com/virusinfo/analyses/w32nyxemd.html and see if your
>> system needs to be cleaned up.
>>
>> Cheers,
>>
> If tlroche doesn't or cant stop these messages, then maybe we should
> remove him from the list - there's nothing stopping him re-joining with
> a new name and email address (from an uninfected PC).
>
> Note: This isn't the only list he's on that is getting spamed with virus
> attachments
>
